::Zardus::

	Zardus walked through the halls of the Iron Fist, looking 
around and remembering old times. The Alliance had gone far since the 
day when it had been a five-bot group. Zardus and Wolfgang had met up 
with Reptilica and Bloodystrike and had been joined by Ominous Prime. 
That was how it had all started. Soon after, the Alliance built their 
base, allied with the Maximals, and made their mark on the war.
	Zardus turned a corner, walking in a portion of the Iron Fist 
that was unfamiliar to him. He didn't know why he had an urge to walk 
the corridors suddenly, but he turned another corner and walked down 
a dark hallway anyways. He looked around again. This was probably the 
extra residential space, unused in the giant ship, especially since 
all the Alliance bots had their quarters in the Alliance base. The 
Alliance commander frowned, wondering if it would be better to 
relocate everyone to the Iron Fist. It would certainly be easier to 
keep track of them all, and to call them to meeting. Plus, the Iron 
Fist had superior facilities: state-of-the-art scientific labs, 
holographic training rooms, better scanners, advanced monitoring and 
security installations, everything.
	Zardus stopped at a door, the sudden silence caused by the 
stopping of his own footsteps nearly startling him. Something wasn't 
quite right. He could almost tell what exactly it was that wasn't 
right, but it escaped him. He frowned, pressing a button to open the 
door. With a barely audible 'whoosh', the door split in half, sliding 
into both sides of the doorway. The room beyond was completely dark, 
and the non-existant lights of the hallway that the door connected it 
to didn't help illuminate it. Not knowing why, Zardus stepped in, 
closing the door behind him. He reached behind him to find the panel 
that would activate the lights in the room.
	-Leave it. Illumination is not needed.-
	Zardus froze as the voice sounded in his head. It was an 
expressionless, yet slightly amused voice, and he knew what the 
source was. It was the same voice that had ordered him to create the 
Alliance, belonging to the same Vok being that was responsible for 
the relatively-superior abilities of the old Alliance base, as well 
as for the fact that a future self of Zardus, now acting as his 
clone, was on the planet. He looked down at his left hand, examining 
the clear blue stone that was burned into it, which was the Vok 
being's way of controlling Zardus and communicating to him. The orb 
was shining. With a small flash, the orb disabled every monitoring 
device in the room. According to the Iron Fist's computers now, the 
room Zardus was in didn't even exist.
	"Wh-AAAHHH!!" Zardus fell to his knees as pain swamped his 
body, originating from his left palm and overloading every other 
feeling. The pain receeded after a few seconds, leaving a dull ache 
behind. Zardus slowly got to his feet.
	"I see you're back," he said drily, walking wearily to the 
bed in the room and sitting down. Now that the orb was illuminating 
the room, he could see his surroundings. It was a standard set of 
quarters. Next to the bed Zardus was sitting on was a table and 
several chairs, and a computer console was built into the far wall.
	-Excellent observation,- the voice in his head replied, 
sounding amused, -I'm glad to see that you're not completely useless.-
	Zardus layed back on the bed, completely exausted. The 
several seconds of torture had drained him of his energy. "Why are 
you back?"
	-Tell me Zardus,- the Vok contines, ignoring his question, -
Why did I establish the Alliance?-
	"You didn-AAAHH!" Zardus yelled out and curled up in near-
fetal position as the pain came back. When it stopped, he relaxed, 
breathing heavily.
	-As I was saying,- the voice's tone was still amused, -Why 
did I establish the Alliance?-
	"To eliminate the other bots on the planet," Zardus responded 
between breaths. He moved so that he was laying on his back.
	-Yess... And have you been doing that?-
	"Yes-AAHHH!"
	-Every time you lie to me, I will influct pain. Understood?- 
The voice was now strict, and Zardus knew that playing games with it 
would be very painful.
	"Yes." The reply was rather weak, Zardus laying almost limp.
	-Good. Now I will repeat my question: Have you been 
eliminating the other bots on the planet?-
	"Not really," Zardus was beginning to regain his breath, and 
his energy level was slowly climbing back to normal, "But the 
Alliance IS the most powerful faction on the planet."
	-Did I ask about the Alliance being powerful?- Before Zardus 
could answer, the orb went on, -You haven't been doing your job, 
Zardus. I expect you'll make a better effort from now on?-
	"Yes. But we are currently destroying the Maxim-AAH!"
	-The Alliance is currently leaving the Maximal base. You are 
doing the same thing you have done to survive ever since the 
beginning, but The Alliance is now strong enough to leave that 
behind. Let me remind you how it began.- Zardus's optics flashed with 
a bright white light, blinding him.
	
	Zardus opened his eyes. Even before they came completely into 
focus, he could tell that he was in a forest. He blinked a few times, 
looking around him. He was laying on his back on the ground. Trees 
rose all around him, blocking out the sky, although he knew it was 
night. Zardus knew perfectly well where and when he was. He was at 
the point in time when the Alliance was first serioustly suggested.
	Zardus could hear small animals scurrying around him. He knew 
that a storm was coming. Slowly, the Alliance commander got to his 
feet and looked around. It was the right forest, yes. Zardus 
activated his jetpack, passing through the trees and looking around 
once he was clear of them. It was just as he remembered it. The 
forest was completely peaceful, the impending storm somehow 
increasing that peacefulness rather than taking from it. Most of the 
forest was less dense than the spot he had appeared in, and he could 
see the ground in many places. A crack cut the forest in two where a 
river passed. Zardus knew that was where the action was going to take 
place. Whether there had been much action or not, he didn't know, but 
he imagined that it would be intersting to watch himself being 
recruited by a Vok being.
	Suddenly, he spun around. Two bots were approaching about two 
dozen yards in front of him. He recognized both of them instantly.
	The bot to the left was named Wolfgang. He was a Predacon, or 
had been originally, but had been kicked out along with Zardus 
himself. Him and Zardus had been working together most of their lives 
untill this point, and would continue to work together for quite a 
while. Wolfgang, in his beast mode of an arctic wolf, was being 
propelled by his jetpack as he flew alongside the other bot.
	The other bot was Zardus himself, or his past self. He was 
smaller than Zardus was now, but was still completely black. Zardus's 
past self was in robot mode, with his rifle in reach. The soon-to-be 
Alliance commander's eyes glowed red, and he was carefully scanning 
the area. Soon, Zardus knew, his past self would detect the Vok 
presence, and it would begin.
	Sure enough, in several seconds, past Zardus turned to 
Wolfgang, saying something that Zardus couldn't hear and then flying 
off to the side. Zardus followed him, staying well behind.
	-Don't worry,- the voice sounded in his head, -He can't 
detect or see you.-
	Zardus nodded, speeding up and following closer behind his 
past self. He stayed in the air, watching past Zardus land on the 
streambed and walk up to the orb that was floating there. The orb 
flickered and approached past Zardus, suddenly zooming to his left 
hand and burning into it. It had begun. Zardus's past self yelled in 
pain, grabbing his left hand with his right. In his mind, Zardus 
could clearly hear the conversation that the Vok being had had with 
him at that time, so long ago in this forest, the forest long since 
scarred by the presence of the Alliance base being in it. He heard 
the Vok order him to create a new faction.
	With a bright white flash, Zardus was blinded again.

	-Remember now?-
	Zardus opened his eyes. He was still on the bed, where he had 
been for all of the five seconds that it had taken for the orb to 
show him that vision. He graned and sat up, nodding at the orb's 
question.
	-Good. Now I will depart for a while. There are several 
protoforms in this ship that are waiting to be activated. I have left 
their location in your data tracks. Activate them when you want. I 
will return soon, and then you will go into training.-
	"I don't nee-AAAHHH!" Zardus fell back to the bed, awash with 
pain. He weakly sat up again when the pain passed several seconds 
later.
	-I will be back. For now, you have some time to yourself.-
	The orb in Zardus's hand stopped shining, and Zardus felt the 
Vok presence leave. He was alone once more.
	The Alliance commander stood up, walking to the door and 
exiting the room. He walked down the dark hallway again, heading for 
the bridge of the Iron Fist.
